column1: Keratsini (Greek: Κερατσίνι) is a suburb in the western part of the Piraeus regional unit
column2: it is part of Athens agglomeration
column3: Greece. Since the 2011 local government reform it is part of the municipality Keratsini-Drapetsona
column4: of which it is the seat and a municipal unit.

column1: Keratsini is situated on the Saronic Gulf coast
column2: 3 km (1.9 mi) northwest of Piraeus and about 10 kilometres (6 miles) west of Athens city centre. The municipal unit has an area of 7.601 km2. The coastal area consists mainly of port facilities
column3: part of the Port of Piraeus.

column1: Keratsini has its own non-professional choir (mixed voices
column2: SATB). It has participated many times in festivals all around Greece. The town has its own choir festival called international song festival.

column1: Keratsini hosts the football club Keratsini FC with earlier presence in Gamma Ethniki and the basketball club Faros Keratsiniou B.C. with presence in A2 Ethniki basketball.
